location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: The correspondence is arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the volume.

Foliation: the main foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1 and terminates at the inside back cover with 7; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located at the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An additional foliation sequence is present in parallel between ff 4-6; these numbers are also written in pencil and circled, but are crossed through.

mods.abstract: The file contains correspondence between the Government of India, External Affairs Department, the Secretary of State for India, and the Ministry of Information, Censorship Division, regarding intercepted Italian and German broadcasts of an alleged engagement between the Fakir of Ipi and British troops.
